Class Driver

  • java.lang.Object
    • Driver

  • public class Driver
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains the main method and runs the entire program. Created by Steven Bruman on 1/24/2018. Edited by Steven Bruman and William Jacobs Version 4/18/2018

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        This is the main method which makes use of processMenuCommand() method method.
        Parameters:
        args - Unused.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - On input error.
        See Also:
        IOException

      • processMenuCommand

        public static boolean processMenuCommand(int command)
        This method processes the menu command chosen by the user. 1 plays the game, 2 show the rules, 3 ends the game session.
        Parameters:
        command - The command chosen by the user at the game menu.
        Returns:
        boolean Whether or not the user chose to end the game session.

      • showRules

        public static void showRules()
        This method will be used to print the rules of the game so that a player can understand how to play.

      • playGame

        public static void playGame()
        This method starts the game. It allows the player to set up the board, then sets up the AI. It randomly selects who has the first turn. It then alternates between the players until the game ends.

      • printGameMenu

        public static void printGameMenu()
        This method prints the game menu for the user.

      • setupArmies

        public static void setupArmies(Unit[][][] armies)
        This method creates the Units for both players and allows them to set up the board.
        Parameters:
        armies - The 3D array of Units that is divided (Player, AI), (Alive, Dead), actual pieces.

      • printBoard

        public static void printBoard(Unit[][] board)
        This method prints the game board at the current state for the player to view. It prints the user's pieces as the value and the AI's pieces as A. It also prints a coordinate system around the outside of the board to help the player as well as L's to represent the lakes in the center of the board.
        Parameters:
        board - The 2D Unit array that represents (X,Y) locations on the board.

      • setupBoard

        public static void setupBoard(Unit[][] board,
                              Unit[][][] armies)
        This method calls the initial set up methods for both the user and AI.
        Parameters:
        board - The 2D Unit array that represents (X,Y) locations on the board.
        armies - The 3D array of Units that is divided (Player, AI), (Alive, Dead), actual pieces.

      • playerChoosePiece

        public static void playerChoosePiece(Unit[][] board,
                                     Unit[] army)
                              throws java.io.IOException
        This method prints the available Units that are left to set up and allows the user to select one.
        Parameters:
        board - The 2D Unit array that represents (X,Y) locations on the board.
        army - The array of Units that represents the pieces of the user.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - On input error.
        See Also:
        IOException

      • playerChooseSpace

        public static boolean playerChooseSpace(int unit,
                                        Unit[][] board,
                                        Unit[] army)
                                 throws java.io.IOException
        This method prints the available locations that are left on the board in the user's initial area and allows the user to select one.
        Parameters:
        unit - The index in army of the Unit that the player selected.
        board - The 2D Unit array that represents (X,Y) locations on the board.
        army - The array of Units that represents the pieces of the user.
        Returns:
        boolean True if the Unit could be placed, otherwise false.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - On input error.
        See Also:
        IOException

      • aiSetup

        public static void aiSetup(Unit[][] board,
                           Unit[] army)
        This method randomly assigns all of the AI's pieces to valid starting locations.
        Parameters:
        board - The 2D Unit array that represents (X,Y) locations on the board.
        army - The array of Units that represents the pieces of the AI.

      • buildShadowBoard

        public static void buildShadowBoard(Unit[][] board,
                                    Unit[][] sb,
                                    Unit[] sa)
        This method creates the AI's imperfect and statistical view of the game.
        Parameters:
        board - The 2D Unit array that represents (X,Y) locations on the board.
        sb - (shadowBoard) The 2D array of Units that represents AI's view of the board.
        sa - (shadowArmy) The array of Units that represents the AI's view of the user's initial set up.

      • aiInitialValues

        public static void aiInitialValues(double[][] values)
        This method generates the initial values that the AI will use to setup. This is similar to the buildShadowBoard method, but the values generated here will be modified and slightly randomized in other methods.
        Parameters:
        values - The 2D array that the AI will use to store the win rates of every piece in every starting spot

      • aiConfig

        public static void aiConfig(double[][] values,
                            double[][] modified)
        This method will modify the values in the values array based on the slightly randomized win rates of different starting configurations.
        Parameters:
        values - The 2D array that the AI will use to store the win rates of every piece in every starting spot
        modified - The 2D array that counts the number of times each value in the values array was modified

      • aiTeam

        public static void aiTeam(double[][] values,
                          double[][] modified)
        This method will modify the values in the values array based on the slightly randomized win rates of different starting configurations.
        Parameters:
        values - The 2D array that the AI will use to store the win rates of every piece in every starting spot
        modified - The 2D array that counts the number of times each value in the values array was modified

      • aiPlaceUnits

        public static void aiPlaceUnits(double[][] values,
                                Unit[][] board,
                                Unit[] army)
        This method places the AI's pieces on the board by selecting the highest values that it finds.
        Parameters:
        values - The 2D array that the AI will use to store the win rates of every piece in every starting spot
        board - The 2D Unit array that represents (X,Y) locations on the board.
        army - The array of Units that represents the AI's pieces.

      • playerMove

        public static boolean playerMove(Unit[][] board,
                                 Unit[][][] armies,
                                 Unit[][] shadowBoard,
                                 Unit[] shadowArmy,
                                 java.util.ArrayList<Moves> memory,
                                 java.util.ArrayList<Moves> shadow)
                          throws java.io.IOException
        Lets the player make a move.
        Parameters:
        board - 2 dimensional Unit object, The current state of the board.
        armies - 3 dimensional Unit object, [owner][y][x].
        shadowBoard - The 2D array of Units that represents AI's view of the board.
        shadowArmy - The array of Units that represents the AI's view of the user's initial set up.
        memory - ArrayList of Moves which stores pieces to retain pieceTypes rather than Moves from the generateMoves method.
        shadow - The ArrayList containing the last 2 moves of the player on the shadowboard
        Returns:
        boolean Whether the game has ended or not
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - On input error.
        See Also:
        IOException

      • aiMove

        public static boolean aiMove(Unit[][] board,
                             Unit[][][] armies,
                             Unit[][] shadowBoard,
                             Unit[] shadowArmy,
                             java.util.ArrayList<Moves> memory,
                             java.util.ArrayList<Moves> shadowAI,
                             java.util.ArrayList<Moves> shadowP)
        This method allows the AI to make a move. This happens by creating a State to represent the current State of the board. This is then run a Minimax algorithm utilizing alpha-beta pruning to select the best move for the AI on its turn.
        Parameters:
        board - The 2D Unit array that represents (X,Y) locations on the board.
        armies - The 3D array of Units that is divided (Player, AI), (Alive, Dead), actual pieces.
        shadowBoard - The 2D array of Units that represents AI's view of the board.
        shadowArmy - The array of Units that represents the AI's view of the user's initial set up.
        memory - The ArrayList containing the last 2 moves of the AI.
        shadowAI - The ArrayList containing the last 2 moves of the AI on the shadowboard.
        shadowP - The ArrayList containing the last 2 moves of the player on the shadowboard.
        Returns:
        boolean Whether or not the game has ended.

      • moveFilter

        public static java.util.ArrayList<Moves> moveFilter(Unit[][] board,
                                                    Players player,
                                                    boolean print,
                                                    java.util.ArrayList<Moves> past)

      • ruleBook

        public static Moves ruleBook(Moves offense,
                             Moves defense,
                             Players p,
                             boolean print)
        ruleBook() serves to simplify the process of which pieces will occupy a space on the board at a given time.
        Parameters:
        offense - - a Moves object wishing to dominate defense for a space on the board.
        defense - - a Moves object which offense wishes to overtake on the board.
        p - - The player who owns the attacking piece.
        print - - Whether or not the results should be printed to the screen.
        Returns:
        winner - the Moves object which dominates, null if both pieces strength's match.
